interestingFact: The United States has the world's largest economy and is home to Silicon Valley, the global hub of technology innovation.
China has the world's largest population and is home to the Great Wall, which is visible from space.
India is the world's largest democracy and the birthplace of the number zero.
Brazil has the Amazon Rainforest, which produces 20% of the world's oxygen, and is the largest coffee producer.
Russia is the largest country by land area and has the world's longest railway, the Trans-Siberian Railway.
The UK has the world's oldest monarchy and is the birthplace of Shakespeare.
Germany is known for its engineering and automotive industry and hosts the world’s largest beer festival, Oktoberfest.
France is the most visited country in the world and home to the Louvre, the largest art museum.
Japan has the highest life expectancy and more vending machines than people.
Canada is the second-largest country by land area and has the longest coastline in the world.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef and has more kangaroos than people.
Italy is the birthplace of the Renaissance and the home of Vatican City, the smallest country in the world.
South Africa has three capital cities and is known for the discovery of the world's largest diamond.
Mexico was the birthplace of chocolate and has the most museums in the world.
South Korea is known for K-pop, has the fastest internet speed, and celebrates a unique Valentine's Day for singles.
